subject: RE: [junit] How can i test a geter or seter?
msgSnippet: oops... never meant ot be so absolute about whether you were right or wrong; I just wanted to strongly voice my opinion.  He who yells the loudest is heard
messageBody:
oops... never meant ot be so absolute about whether you were right or wrong; I
just wanted to strongly voice my opinion. "He who yells the loudest is heard
the most???" :)

-jason
--- Patrick McGovern <themysterytramp@...> wrote:
>
> i certainly see your point though. there isnt any harm in thoroughly
> testing...you just said i was wrong...and you know how we people are about
> that :)
> Jason Rogers <jacaetev@...> wrote: Show me where Kent ever said
> "don't test the trivial."
>
> BTW: If you can do that, I still will test the trivial! Just my opinion...
>
> -jason
>
> --- Patrick McGovern <themysterytramp@...> wrote:
> > hey, he asked a question.
> >
> > however more seriously, I believe the XP tenets are
> > pretty clear on the testing of trivial methods like
> > this getter...we just dont bother...testing the
> > "internal state" as suggested in another email in this
> > thread would not be an explicit test of this getter
> > but a test of the functions that leave the object in
> > the tested state. It would be an implicit test..which
> > is cool:)
> >
> >
> > Pax Vobiscum;)
> >
> > --- "STRAYER, JON (AIT)" <jon.strayer@...> wrote:
> > > You need a test case for that?
> > >
> > > > -----Original Message-----
> > > > From: Patrick McGovern
> > > [mailto:themysterytramp@...]
> > > > Sent: Friday, December 21, 2001 1:20 PM
> > > > To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> > > > Subject: RE: [junit] How can i test a geter or
> > > seter?
> > > >
> > > >
> > > > would the fact that it won't compile be the
> > > answer?
> > > > --- "STRAYER, JON (AIT)" <jon.strayer@...>
> > > wrote:
> > > > > What could go wrong with this getter that is
> > > worth a
> > > > > test?
> > > > >
> > > > > >
> > > > > > class A {
> > > > > > private int i;
> > > > > > getI(){
> > > > > > return i;
> > > > > > }
> > > > > > }
> > > > > >
> > > > > > I want test the geter,should i make testcase
> > > as a
> > > > > inner class?
> > > > >
> > > >
> > > >
